alert.note: Alert for Bowie; Red River (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 6:20PM CDT until July 08 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Oklahoma and northeast Texas, including the following counties, in southeast Oklahoma, McCurtain. In northeast Texas, Bowie, Cass, Franklin, Morris, Red River and Titus. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clarksville, Hagansport, Bogata, Bagwell, Wilkerson, Manchester, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Detroit, Talco, Cuthand, Harts Bluff, Johntown, Negley, Bryarly, Silver City, Albion, Woodland, Kiomatia, Kanawha and Redland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
